intro: Physedra eglandulosa, commonly known as the smooth physedra, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant features slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in umbels. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a mild, aromatic scent. Physedra eglandulosa is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks.
